questions.questionText: Which of the following does TypeScript use to specify types?
questions.explanation: TS uses a colon (:) to separate the property name from the property type

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a type used in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: enum is not used as a type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: How can we specify properties and methods for an object in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: interfaces are typically used to list the properties and methods for an object

questions.questionText: How else can Array<number> be written in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: number[] is another way of writing Array<number> in TypeScript

questions.questionText: In which of these does a class take parameters?
questions.explanation: a constructor is used by a class to take in parameters

questions.questionText: Which is NOT an access modifier?
questions.explanation: async is not used as an access modifier type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: Which keyword allows us to share information between files in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: the export keyword allows for the information to be transmitted between files

questions.questionText: Which is an array method to generate a new array based on a condition?
questions.explanation: filter is a method used to conditionally create a new array

questions.questionText: How is a property accessible within a class?
questions.explanation: this.propertyName is the way to access a specific property within a class

ordinateur.explanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is the main component of a computer that performs most of the processing.
RAM (Random Access Memory) is a type of computer memory that allows data to be read and written in any order.

options.text: The main circuit board of a computer
A component that displays images on a screen

ordinateur.explanation: The motherboard is the main circuit board of a computer that connects all the other components together.
A GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) is a type of processor that is specifically designed to handle graphics and image processing tasks.

options.text: A component that displays images on a screen
A device for storing digital data

ordinateur.explanation: A hard drive is a device for storing digital data such as files, programs, and operating systems.

options.text: A type of software that helps manage a computer's resources
A component that displays images on a screen

ordinateur.explanation: An operating system is a type of software that manages a computer's resources such as memory, processing power, and storage.

options.text: The last part of a file name that identifies the type of file
The first part of a file name that identifies the type of file
The middle part of a file name that identifies the type of file
A type of file that contains instructions for the computer

ordinateur.explanation: A file extension is the last part of a file name that identifies the type of file, such as .txt for a text file or .jpg for an image file.
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used for styling web pages.

ordinateur.questionText: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
ordinateur.explanation: The <h1> element is used for the largest heading on a web page.

internet.questionText: What is the role of an operating system?

options.text: To manage computer hardware and software resources

internet.explanation: An operating system is responsible for managing the computer's hardware and software resources, providing a platform for other applications to run on.

internet.questionText: What is the function of a kernel?
internet.explanation: The kernel is the core of the operating system that manages the computer's resources, including the CPU, memory, and input/output devices.

options.text: A technique for using the hard disk as an extension of RAM
A method for backing up data to a remote server
A tool for creating virtual machines

internet.explanation: Virtual memory is a technique that allows the operating system to use the hard disk as an extension of RAM, which can increase the amount of memory available to applications.

options.text: An instance of a running program
A method for accessing remote resources
A tool for managing network connections

internet.explanation: A process is an instance of a running program that has its own memory space and resources, such as CPU time and input/output channels.

options.text: The way files are organized on a storage device
A method for backing up data to a remote server
A tool for creating virtual machines

internet.explanation: A file system is the way that files are organized and stored on a storage device, such as a hard disk or solid-state drive.

options.text: Software that allows the operating system to communicate with hardware devices
A tool for managing network connections
A program for creating virtual machines

internet.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used for styling web pages.

internet.questionText: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
internet.explanation: The <h1> element is used for the largest heading on a web page.

internet.questionText: What is the correct way to include a JavaScript file in an HTML page?
internet.explanation: To include a JavaScript file in an HTML page, you can use the <script> element with the 'src' attribute set to the file path.

options.text: A unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) for use as a network address in communications within a network segment.
A unique identifier assigned to a router to identify it on a network.
A protocol used to route data packets between different networks.
A type of cable used to connect devices on a network.

network.explanation: A MAC (Media Access Control) address is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) for use as a network address in communications within a network segment.

options.text: A device that connects two or more networks and forwards data packets between them.
A device that allows multiple devices to connect to a network.
A type of cable used to connect devices on a network.
A protocol used to route data packets between different networks.

network.explanation: A router is a device that connects two or more networks and forwards data packets between them.

options.text: A unique identifier assigned to a device on a network to allow it to communicate with other devices.
A protocol used to route data packets between different networks.
A type of cable used to connect devices on a network.
A device that connects two or more networks and forwards data packets between them.

network.explanation: An IP (Internet Protocol) address is a unique identifier assigned to a device on a network to allow it to communicate with other devices.

options.text: A security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.
A device that allows multiple devices to connect to a network.
A protocol used to route data packets between different networks.
A type of cable used to connect devices on a network.

network.explanation: A firewall is a security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.

options.text: A number that defines the network portion of an IP address.
A number that defines the host portion of an IP address.
A protocol used to route data packets between different networks.
A type of cable used to connect devices on a network.

network.explanation: A subnet mask is a number that defines the network portion of an IP address.
